name: offensively
content:
offensively adverb
(IN A WAY THAT UPSETS SOMEONE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is likely to upset, annoy, or embarrass someone: His comments were offensively patronizing.
More examplesFewer examplesComments that are written offensively or disrespectfully will be deleted. I don't mean this offensively, but while I see your profile as "good" I wouldn't rate it as "excellent".The reality is that someone behaved badly or offensively.It is offensively presumptuous that you claim I have a disregard for human life.

offensively adverb
(IN SPORT)
in a way that relates to getting points in a sport, rather than stopping the other player or team getting points: Joey's got more ability than both of those guys offensively. Opposite
defensively
More examplesFewer examplesDockery is a very good defender, but Nelson is better offensively.Campanella helped his team win by performing offensively and defensively. Offensively, it took our men a little while to break down the high-quality pitching.
